title: Biography
body:
##This is Pete
I have a BFA from the New York State School of Ceramics, School of Art and Design at Alfred University. I studied video / sonic / electronic art, graphic design, photography, kinetic sculpture / instillation art, and interactive / web / new media design. 

After school I worked as a web and graphic designer for a company called Coombs Media, most of the work was for Kodak easyshare cameras. While living in rochester I became involved in the western NY art and music scene as a video artist. I primarily showed work at local one-night-only events, and performed video projections for live bands / and sonic artists. I have 2 independent DVD releases of my video work. The first was called systems and was mostly experimental video work from alfred, the second is called 'Rochester Collaborations' which loosely documents my work from NY, showing the collaborations with the sonic artists and musicians from that scene. 

I moved to California in fall of 2004. After getting re-settled I started a regular VJ gig at club Future, and became active in the indie / electro dance scene as a VJ and promoter. All while holding down a day job as an interactive developer. I started out at MRM / McCann doing some work for Microsoft, and then moved to ATTIK where I launched a number of large creative flash websites for Scion cars.

Currently I work at Odopod as a senior developer, making award winning interactive experiences for Nike, Got Milk, Honda, Google, Nest, Tesla, Sony, Nvidia, Nestea etc. I'm still active as a DJ working with Future Universal, and doing Guest DJ spots at Bootie, Nightlife, and other one-off events. I also have been getting back to my electronic artist / kinetic sculpter roots, and have been building several home-made elctronic projects including my antique electronic weather clock.

My goals for the future are to focus on making interactive experiences beyond the desktop. Projects that get me excited are site specific things such as museum displays, point of purchase, trade show and events booths, public works projects, or dedicated hardware UI for everyday appliances (ambient computing).

##Residencies / Visiting Artist

###Visiting Artist Alfred University Video Department, Jan. 2002
Was asked by the Video faculty to work with Juniors and Seniors to teach them the video processing software "Image/Ine".

###Experimental Television Center, Jun 2000
Participated in the Summer Student Residency at the Experimental Television Center in Owego NY.

##Curatorships

###Equipped, May 2004
One Night Show of Video Instillations and Electronic Music at the Visual Studies Workshop in Rochester NY included 6 video artists and 3 live acts of music plus dj's.

###Co-curator Prominence, 2000 & 2001
Annual collection of student video works from western New York. Curated by students, and shown in several galleries across western NY.

##Exhibitions & Performances

###Plone Conference 2011
DJ for the Plone Developer Conference closing party on Treasure Island. 

###Nightlife 2009 - 2011
Guest DJ for the Cal Academy of Science Nightlife Events

###Bootie SF 2009 - 2011
Regular Guest DJ in the electro lounge for the famous mashup club at DNA Lounge SF.

###Odopod's 10 Year Anniversary Party Dec 2010
Dj'd at Bimbos 365 in SF for the Semi-respetful 10 year anniversary party for odopod.

###FITC afterparty Aug 2010
VJ and DJ for the offical FITC closing party held at Mezzanine SF

###Partyline! Feb - Apr 2010
Resedent DJ and VJ and co-founder of this monthly night at Shine bar SF

###Lacquer Jan - Aug 09
Regular Guest DJ; Beauty Bar SF

###Club Super Ego, Dec 2008 - may 2009
Resident VJ and DJ for this monthly night at DNA Lounge; Fashion, Music, Dance, Glam.

###Opulent Temple, Aug 2008
Guest VJ at the famous Opulent Temple in sunny Black Rock City Nevada.

###Club Electropolis, Oct - Dec 2007
Resident VJ and Co-Host with DJ KidHack for this Bi-weekly night at Etiquette Lounge SF.

###Get Lost, Sept 2007
Guest VJ set with DJ KidHack at Camp Get Lost, Burning Man 2007.

###Supperclub, Aug 2007
Guest VJ set at Supperclub SF

###Club Super Ego,  April - July 2007
Resident VJ and Co-host for this monthly night at Rickshaw Stop SF, Many local DJ's and a couple bands.

###Be The Riottt, Nov 2006
VJ sets for Fingerbangerz, Saul Williams, Metric, and camera mixing for the Rapture. Be The Riottt was held at the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium in San Francisco.

###POP ROXX, April 2006
Guest VJ at club POP ROXX at the DNA Lounge in San Francisco CA.

###Future, Jan - July 2006
Resident VJ for club Future. Monthly Electro club at 330 Ritch in San Francisco CA.

###Envelope, Jan 2006
Rochester Collaborations DVD featured at a Merrostar Collective event at 111 Minna gallery in San Francisco.

###Past to Future, Dec 2005
VJ for underground New Years Eve Party, at Marrakech in San Francisco CA.

###Sea of Dreams, Dec 2005
Guest VJ slot at Anon Salon's Sea of Dreams New Years Eve Party at the SF Concourse Convention Center in San Francisco CA.

###Future, 2005
Resident VJ for club Future. Bi-monthly Electro club at Underground SF in San Francisco CA.

###Video Riot, Nov 2004
Participated in the 2004 Video riot in San Francisco CA.

###Terry Mullens, Venus 7, etc. July 2004
VJ'ed for a night of House DJ's at Water Street Music Hall in Rochester NY.

###Comacast, Unfed, etc. July 2004
Projected live video for a night of industrial music at Vertex in Rochester NY.

###Comacast, July 2004
Projected live video for Industrial band Comacast at ? venue in Buffalo NY.

###Equipped, May 2004
Showed a remix / retrospective of the past year's work. Visual Studies Workshop. Rochester NY.

###Solos, Sept 2004
Showed 'Organics' with audio accompany by sonic artist Marc McNulty. A|V space in Rochester NY.

###Synarsthesia II, Jun 2004
Showed 'Windows on Windows' This sequal show was a two day mixed media art event held at the A|V space in Rochester NY.

###Comacast, April 2004
Projected live video for Industrial band Comacast  at Vertex in Rochester NY.

###Synaesthesia, April 2004
Showed 'When Spaceships Explode' Synaesthesia was a one night show of mixed media artists at the Visual Studies Workshop. Rochester NY.

###init.two, Jan. 2003 
Showed 2 untitled projections of  simulated life-forms. Visual Studied Workshop, Rochester NY. 

###Box Show, Dec 2002 / Jan 2003
Participated in a group show in Jamestown NY.

###Headspace, Jun. 2000 - Mar. 2002
Improv experimental electronic music performance sessions hosted by DJ Chuck Miller on 88.5 WRUR at the University of Rochester.

###BFA Exhibition, May 2001
Solo exhibition included 'Systems' an interactive collection of my video work on DVD, and 'burning-house' a collection of flash projects currently online.

###Prominence, May 2001
Video work 'Triskaidekaphobia' included in an annual collection of student video works from western New York, screened at Alfred.

###Invisible Wall, Nov. 2000
Interactive work 'Headspace Bubble Sampler' exhibited on the interactive touch screen, part of the Invisible Wall at NYSCC School of Art and Design at Alfred University. Alfred NY.

###Student Uprising, 2000
Video work 'Digital Circuits and Diagrams' included in Student Uprising; a show of student work screened at Mobius in Boston MA.

###Threadworm, Jun. 2000 & Oct. 2000
Live mix and projection of video with live music performance by 'Threadworm' at Piranha in Rochester NY.

###Prominence, 2000
Video work 'Digital Circuits and Diagrams' included in an annual collection of student video works from western New York, screened at Hallwalls in Buffalo and Spark in Syracuse NY.

###'Electronics and Mutations,' Apr. 1999
Suspended installation of miscellaneous electronic artifacts in the Snodgrass gallery at the NYSCC School of Art and Design at Alfred University. Alfred NY.

###Open screening events at Alfred University, 1998 - 2001
Two or three times per semester the video department in the NYSCC School of Art and Design host open screenings of video and sound work in which I frequently participated. Alfred NY.
